p: Favipiravir (T-705; 6-fluoro-3-hydroxy-2-pyrazinecarboxamid, AviganÂ®) is an antiviral drug that selectively inhibited the RdRP of influenza virus [ 83]. It showed specific activity against all three influenza A, B, and C [ 84, 85]. The primary mechanism of action of favipiravir against the influenza virus was through specific inhibition to vRNA polymerase [ 86]. Favipiravir functions as a purine homologue, where vRNA polymerase mistakenly recognizes favipiravir-RTP as a purine nucleotide resulted in inhibition of viral RNA synthesis [ 86].
